para: &app;, like most GNU projects, allows a user to select various options before compiling its source code. These options include selecting from the available features, specifying custom paths for installation, and cross compiling. &app; uses GNU Autoconf for configuration.

If you opted to download the development checkout of &app;, the configure script will not be included. It can be created by running autogen.sh from the source root directory:
./autogen.sh
Note that there are some dependencies for autogen.

All the standard configure options are available. In addition, &app; has two types of options: those that enable or disable features, and those that specify custom paths for development packages which are not found during the default search. A complete list of all configuration options, including standard ones, can be seen by typing:
./configure --help |less
Read further for a more detailed explanation of &app;-specific options.

The syntax for running configure is as follows:
configure <options>
